intro: Dianthus alpinus var. semenovii, commonly known as the Siberian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring sturdy stems and clustered flowers. The flowers are pink to red in color, with five petals and a distinctive central tuft of stamens, giving it a showy appearance. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking hardy, ornamental plants.
